newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MARTFU APPROVES MERGER, 15 PCT '96 DIVIDEND.
newsitem.headline: MARTFU APPROVES MERGER, 15 PCT '96 DIVIDEND.

text.p: Shareholders of Hungarian brewery Martfu decided that five Martfu shares will be exchanged for four Soproni shares under the merger of Martfu into Soproni, a Martfu official said on Thursday.
The annual shareholders meeting of Martfu held on Thursday also decided to pay 15 percent dividend on the company's 1996 earnings, Martfu accountant Erzsebet Burjan told Reuters.
Martfu's registered capital is 1.071 billion forints and the total amount it will pay out as dividend for 1996 is 160.65 million forints, she said.
Under the merger, Soproni will issue new shares for the exchange, raising its registered capital to 2.21 billion forints from 1.35 billion forints, Burjan added.
The face value of both Martfu and Soproni shares is 1,000 forints.
Both breweries are subsidiaries of Austrian brewery Brau Union AG .
Brau AG said earlier that it planned to merge the two units to make its Hungarian operations more successful.
Martfu closed at 3,110 forints on the Budapest Stock Exchange, down 40 forints. Soproni finished at 5,900 forints, down 50.
